Description: Historical record - highest rainfall ever recorded in Leh during 24-hour period: 51.3mm
Historical cloudburst in Leh, received 60mm rain in couple of hours - referenced for comparison with 2010 event
Cloudbursts in upper reaches of Sainj valley caused flash floods, affecting 40 families and washing away 2 bridges
Flash flood caused 12 deaths and loss of 150 cattle heads. Bridge connecting Deol and Baijnath washed away
Couple buried alive, 2 children injured after flash flood washed away two houses
7 persons died, 15 houses, 12 cows, 18 oxen, 40 sheep washed away along with 115 bighas of agricultural land
Flash floods killed 21 people and left 21 others with major injuries. 9 remain missing
30 people lost their lives, 19 were injured and 9 missing; 2 persons lost their lives due to landslide in Bahang nalla
58 people died and the village completely cut off as all roads disappeared
Devastating cloudburst triggered flash floods and mudslides in Leh town and surrounding areas. Worst affected areas were Choglamsar, Saboo, and Phyang.
Two persons killed, 22 injured and at least a dozen missing after cloudburst near South portal of Rohtang Tunnel
Cloudburst led to flash floods and Chorabari glacial lake burst on June 17, devastating Kedarnath town and surrounding valleys
First cloudburst incident of 2018 in Chamoli district, vehicles trapped in debris but no human casualties reported

Location: Multiple locations (Tehri, Pouri, Uttarkashi, Nainital, Pithoragarh)
Description: Series of cloudbursts across five districts, damaged fields, water mills, cowsheds, and closed Badrinath highway for 8 hours
Glacial lake outburst flood caused by rock and ice avalanche, affecting Rishiganga and Dhauliganga rivers
Cloudburst impacted about 8 homes and damaged wheat crops and apple orchards in Kutaul stream catchment
Cloudbursts at three locations caused large scale destruction to village properties and public infrastructure
Cloudburst incident in Bharain area of Kullu district
Flash floods triggered by cloudburst in Tozing Nullah, Udaipur sub-division
Cloudburst reported around Amarnath cave in south Kashmir, but no loss or injury reported
Devastating cloudburst and flash floods in Hunzar hamlet of Kishtwar district
Cloudburst near Amarnath Cave Shrine swept away tents and community kitchens during peak pilgrimage season
Multiple cloudbursts across Mandi district causing significant casualties
Part of widespread cloudbursts across Himachal Pradesh during July 2023
Severe cloudburst in Thunag area of Mandi district
5 MW Brahmaganga HEP faced flashflood threats due to cloudburst
Massive landslide near Shiv Mandir in Summer Hill area triggered by cloudburst
First cloudburst incident of 2024 SW monsoon season in Kinnaur district
Sudden flood in Karpat nullah affected 35 families and caused severe damage to public properties, crops and farming land
Devastating cloudburst in Samej village, part of multiple simultaneous cloudbursts. Water level rose 35-45m, width expanded from 40m to 180m
Cloudburst in Thalatukhod area of Padhar, part of the July 31-August 1 multiple cloudburst event
Cloudburst near Village Jaon in Tehsil Nirmand, part of five simultaneous cloudbursts between July 31-August 1
Last cloudburst incident of 2024 SW monsoon season in Sirmaur district
Severe cloudburst with torrential rains, hailstorms, and strong winds. Over 100 people rescued, 40 houses damaged in Dharam Kund village
Series of cloudbursts and flash floods across Kangra and Kullu districts
Massive flash flood following cloudburst damaged Jiwa SHP powerhouse and weir site completely
Cloudburst caused landslides and disrupted key pilgrimage routes, several workers missing
Series of 10 cloudbursts across Mandi district affecting Thunag, Janjehli, Karsog, Gohar, and Dharampur areas
